intro: Mentzelia montana, commonly known as the mountain bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Mentzelia montana is known for its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
